intro: Pilosella sandrasica, commonly known as the sandrasic mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, grayish-blue foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to certain regions of Europe, it thrives in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and gravelly areas. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and is often found in disturbed or marginal environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native range.
